body:
Thank you Abraham for your effort and your advice (about good behaviour to improve my workflow). I did a lot of attempts: 1) update my GH to last version; (after tried to run your GH_A version file) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/MjUiWVyv*JIyr8ob5V*-whtbCCYi6kXXvZ4BmWkqI-iVYCAGQzQn66ImQ7*CO79*QVPDcShZUunhoNPDHs5SJ0yan5T9A6sL/error_gh_vers.PNG) 2) updated LHHB files by tour "update component" (because i've noticed from this link [https://app.box.com/s/02d7kp230vb045i9j4ix](https://app.box.com/s/02d7kp230vb045i9j4ix) there's old version yet) 3)I replaced every component with the new ones (HB 0.53). The result is the same, HDR>GIF componet displays: 1. Failed to genearate the .gif file. Open the bat file with a text editor and change the last line from exit to pause. Then run it again and see what is the error.
here is the file address: c:/ladybug//JackTest053/imageBasedSimulation//HDR2GIF.BAT Maybe it's me, but i've noticed the HDR>HDR path it isn't the right path, then when i connect HDR>HDR output to EmbryoViz it doesn't crash (or display the bleeding window) but display this error baloon: 1. Path must be a valid location at this point i suppose (it's only a beginner user opinion) it could be the wrong output path the real problem? [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/MjUiWVyv*JJLM8mXD7UzU3UrvCaGPMp1kVqwwFPPe7AlE4iMCukX1qfy4PmDrVer3MthNfKm2E*RMNl*gzbcr-8q9t27VQEj/Cattura.PNG)
